result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery C Bates II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jeffery C Bates II

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay a fine of $600.00 plus costs and disbursements including the DNA surcharge by the end of probationary period. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against the defendant.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court advised defendant of the determinate sentence pursuant to statue and in accordance with Form CR-234.

- AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
- Random urine screens to ensure compliance.
- Cooperate and participate in the Mandatory Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

timeConds.notes:
CONSECUTIVE; GOOD TIME.
Huber privileges for work and child care - not more than 60 hours a week.

Defendant Jeffery C Bates in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  Joint stipulation for adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Hazel Jean Washington in court.  Defendant, Jeffrey C Bates, II, NOT in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared (via email) for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter scheduled for plea/sentencing on February 26, 2016.  Attorney Washington came in and informed the Clerk the defense will be requesting an adjournment.  The State does not object.  Matter is adjourned to April 5, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for plea/sentencing.

Defendant Jeffery C Bates in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. 15RM009254  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-19-2015

No driving without a valid license.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of  bail jumping.

Defendant Jeffery C Bates in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jeffery C Bates in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
